function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Critique of the biodiversity-buffers-disease paradigm","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-linear relationship between biodiversity and dilution effect","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adding non-competent and competent host species in city environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in biodiversity may lead to proliferation of pest and harmful organisms in urban environments.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disease-protective effects of biodiversity may not effectively reduce the transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased prevalence of human schistosomiasis from dam constructions","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Arsenic exposure in bangladesh from construction of tube wells","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in human wastewater","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enteric involvement in hospitalised patients with covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unavailability of the exact number of covid-19 positive patients","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Immunosuppression in asymptomatic liver transplant recipients","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential enteric transmission of sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential community spread of sars-cov-2","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of covid-19 in tourism destinations due to reduced risk perception and information mismanagement","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Negative influence on country and destination image due to misinformation and racial references related to covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of detail-oriented behavior and increased spontaneous trait inferences leading to risk of epidemic spread","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Psychological distance and construal level theory influencing perceived risk in tourism contexts may lead to inaccurate risk perceptions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Individuals’ varying construal of psychological distance and covid-19-related risk perceptions may lead to inconsistent travel willingness and preferences.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dissemination of negative messages through social media may exacerbate country image problems and increase anxiety among tourists.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in small accommodation units due to shortened social distance with tourists","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Person-to-person transmission of contagious diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in tourist preferences due to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased preference for private transportation over public transportation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived health risks related to covid-19 in tourism activities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological risks related to anxiety and fear about covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tourists consuming foreign or exotic foods may be blamed for disease transmission, leading to social risk.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Biased risk perceptions of covid-19, with individuals perceiving their own risk as lower than others.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in risk perceptions based on demographic characteristics, epidemics.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public concern and criticism of wildlife consumption may lead to heated debates and social unrest, impacting tourism and local communities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Tourists modifying transportation modes to prefer self-driving tours or recreational vehicles, leading to potential increase in road accidents and traffic congestion.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Tourists avoiding public transport due to fear of contracting illnesses, leading to decreased usage of public transport and potential overcrowding of roads and highways.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Preference for private car services leading to decreased social distancing and increased risk of disease transmission within the vehicle.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Psychological reservations affecting destination choices","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased risk perception leading to modification of destination
